intro: Sisyrinchium angustifolium f. album, commonly known as the white narrowleaf blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and showy, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and prairies. Its flowers bloom in early summer and are often visited by pollinators like bees and butterflies. This subspecies is distinguished by its lighter-colored flowers compared to the typical greenish-yellow variety of the species.
